website_summaries.verdict: Good range and battery life in a unit that gives you a reliable level of performance.
pros: Excellent transmission range of up to 50 meters
Has a battery life of up to 50 hours in search mode or up to 250 hours in normal transmit mode
cons: May switch from transmit to search mode without your input

customer_reviews.title: Received defective device
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new Tracker 3 and used for 2 months. Used the beacon during an AIARE avalanche training/rescue course. The beacon severely underperformed in side by side range beacon test to detect transmitting beacon from 20-50 meters away. Device locked on target within 20 meter range however the range test was performed multiple times, resetting device (off/on), and still underperformed to detect transmitting beacon at the maximum 40 meters of range listed by the manufacturer. Sending back to the manufacturer.

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe glitch
customer_reviews.text: I bought the tracker 3 last year and have been very happy with it. Simple and reliable to use and light weight. Reliable until it stopped transmitting a signal without warning, only searching even when on the transmit function. I take great care of my gear, and always take the batteries out of my transceiver at the end of winter. This is my second BCA beacon, but after this spooky experience that totally compromises the safety of myself and the group I'm with combine with the disappointing customer service of BCA I'll never feel safe or happy using their beacons again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use. great size
customer_reviews.text: I have this beacon in my pocket every day I ski which is approximately 150 days a year. The beacon is a great size and very efficient to use. It has a signal suppression button for multiple burials which adds to its versatility. Simplicity is the name of the game with beacons and I'm very happy with this offering from BCA.

customer_reviews.title: Small, lightweight, comfortable, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and discrete, it fits comfortably across your body or in an interior pocket. As a girl, I really appreciate how comfortably it fits across my body. Has great battery life and is easy to use.

product_meta.title: Backcountry Access Tracker 3
product_meta.description: Backcountry Access stepped it up again this winter with its all-new Tracker3 Avalanche Beacon. Twenty percent lighter and smaller than its big brother, the Tracker2, the Tracker3 contains real-time display, a third receiving antenna, and markings for multiple burials. Its progressive industrial design creates unmatched wearing comfort and user experience.
feature_bullets: Unit weight with batteries: 7.6 ounces/215 grams, Harness weight: 3.5 oz/100 grams
Frequency: 457 kHz, Batteries: three AAA alkaline
Battery life: minimum 1 hour in search mode after 200 hours in transmit mode (approximately 250 hours in transmit only or 50 hours in search only)
Certified to be in compliance with all applicable North American and European norms
